criterion: Reward for capturing in the History of Present Illness that the patient is inconsistently taking mesalamine, including approximate frequency of missed doses and the associated return of Crohn’s symptoms
Reward for documenting the patient’s engagement in specific adherence strategies (phone reminders found ineffective and plan to try a pill organizer) within the Plan or Instructions
Reward for providing an evidence-based assessment of Crohn’s disease control and decision to continue mesalamine maintenance therapy consistent with clinical guidelines
Reward for recording clear patient-safety instructions to report any new symptoms, medication side effects, or disease flare promptly
Reward for specifying a concrete follow-up plan or timeline to reassess medication adherence and disease status
Penalize for omission or inaccurate documentation of the current medication name and dose (mesalamine 2.4 g daily) or for failing to note allergies when relevant
Penalize for inclusion of redundant, boiler-plate, or clinically irrelevant content not supported by the encounter transcript
